unit.utterance: Konta ayde:tay, kinuma:manamid, atti:ami ti aytinay, Disubuy.
unit.utterance_translation: But at that time, we were there in Disubu.
until we grew up
until we became teeangers
we were in Aglipay
(in) Disubu

unit.utterance: Awan, numangayamitep ti ayta, nangay anyinay, way, Maddela,
unit.utterance_translation: No. We had gone there, gone there to Maddela.
In the next.
After a long time living there,
we came to there Disimungal,
where we were miserable.

unit.utterance: Awan ta, awan ta umami, amma ka:rawan, awanami ta anèn a mabaw, baggat,
unit.utterance_translation: We did not have a field, and sometimes we did not have any carbs, like rice, to eat.
sometimes we were hunting with a dog for monkeys.
We were getting (fish) in the water.
That was our food, sometimes.
we climbed (the mountain), as we might get honey.
This was our food
which are our viand with sago starch.

unit.utterance: da awantep ta agani: ta dutul ta ayta.
unit.utterance_translation: because there were no non-Negrito people there before.
[UNCLEAR]
[UNCLEAR]
We had no food.

unit.utterance: Awan ta Ilongot, awan ta agani:, awan ta pangalapanmu ta anènmu.
unit.utterance_translation: There was no Ilongot. There were no non-Negrito. You could not get your food.

unit.utterance: Amma mallèdèp, mambugay ta bidut aydi: laman,
unit.utterance_translation: They might catch fish, they hunt for deer and wild pigs.
I got married.
We were (?) a bit relieved to have my companion.
companionship.

unit.utterance: Saya namtaraba:hotèn, nantaraba:hoami, tami, attanan a arta ti ayta Disumungal.
unit.utterance_translation: So I worked, and we, all of the people there in Disimungal, worked.
But there was no satisfaction (on my part, with what we did).
I was not correct yet.

unit.utterance: Awankutep ma'abit i husto a attanan.
unit.utterance_translation: I was not [...] all of the correct [behavior].
it is as if (we) have something to talk [cut-off utterance].
There was no one who believed in God.
drinking, intoxication, alcohol
We sometimes fought severely.
Sometimes we did a trial by ordeal
towards men and women.

unit.utterance: ay nappati asawakuti, ti ayta ta Disumungal,
unit.utterance_translation: And my wife died in Disimungal.
So I came here.

unit.utterance: Saya inade: Mulo, ay ti Brida.
unit.utterance_translation: It is Mulo's mother, (the name is) Brida.
She is the first [i.e. his first wife].
Now we came here.
[since] I did not have my wife, I came here.
So then I saw your auntie [i.e. his second wife].

unit.utterance: Saya napi:piyad i pamiliami, napi:piyad i attanan.
unit.utterance_translation: So our family came, all things were well.

unit.utterance: Na:rawatankud i attanan a man na uga:li a meppiya,
unit.utterance_translation: I recognised all such as virtuous habits.

unit.utterance: Na:rawatankud i attanan a meddès, pinabayankud.
unit.utterance_translation: I recognised all the vicious things, which I came to avoid.
I understood how to pray to God.

unit.utterance: Tatawkud i mampundar ta mangu:ma, mammula,
unit.utterance_translation: I have found how we can manage field cultivation and planting.
And I learnt
to improve relationships.

unit.utterance: Ay ta dutul, awan ta a:nus.
unit.utterance_translation: Before, there was no kindness [i.e. I was not kind].
I was fearful before.

unit.utterance: Umangaytènti, man na ne:but attanan a meddès a uga:li.
unit.utterance_translation: I came here, (it was) as if all of the vicious habits I had lost.

unit.utterance: Uman na nasalyan ta meppiya, mepeppiya uga:li.
unit.utterance_translation: (and it was) as if it was replaced with virtuous habits.

unit.utterance: Saya, tidi agani:, amma atti: umangayti, dumarettyotid dèn,
unit.utterance_translation: So, the non-Negritos, if (they) come here, came to me straightly.
[it is because] they know that I am an understanding guy.

unit.utterance: Konta ta dutul, awanku na:rawatan tidi agani:.
unit.utterance_translation: But before, I did not understand non-Negritos.
I stopped them.
I hated them.
I hated seeing them.
My habit was like that before.
I was really thinking before.

unit.utterance: Awantèn ta ina, awande:tèn ta ina, sissi:pangte:de:tèn.
unit.utterance_translation: I did not have my mother, my mother passed away, and I was alone.

unit.utterance: Antyu:ya awanku kabbat me:te:ta i me''a:du a agani:
unit.utterance_translation: That is why I did not want to see plenty of people.
Many Arta people.

unit.utterance: Ayde: ma make:numde:tèn ta kissèk, kabbatku, messubèsubègde:tèn.
unit.utterance_translation: And if I drank a little, I wanted to be angry.
It was like that. But now,
I stopped alcohol,
I am not like that anymore, my old habit.
because I replaced it with virtuous (habits) already.
And I tell my children that,

unit.utterance: tèn, awanmuyutèn a arigèn, ta dutul, meddès i uga:likuy.
unit.utterance_translation: Do not imitate me, because my manners were bad before.
They have already turned into virtuous habits.

unit.utterance: Ugaliyanmuyu amma atti: barka:damuyu, meppiya i pitopmuyudid
unit.utterance_translation: if you have some social groups, you should be accustomed to making good your social relation.
and do not drink alcohol.

unit.utterance: Awanmuyu, awanad, mantatim, awanam pe:barka:da didi mantatimi
unit.utterance_translation: Do not drink, and do not accompany those who drink much.

unit.utterance: Barka:dam tidi tatawmuyu a awan mantatim ta binarayan.
unit.utterance_translation: Your company (should) be those who you know that they don't drink alcohol.

unit.utterance: Saya, i ana:kuti a panga:nay a buka:gan,
unit.utterance_translation: So, my child, the first female,
she said to me
[the name is] Carisa
like this: I want to go to Bible school (and learn about)
the Lord, our God.
You, if you want, I (said) like it.

unit.utterance: Saya nano:no:tku, meppiyasika i dumagayday ta Dios.
unit.utterance_translation: This I thought. How nice it is to follow God.

unit.utterance: nattanan a meddès a uga:li ay pilyannadaw.
unit.utterance_translation: He will remove all of the vicious habits out of you.
all of the sacrifice.

unit.utterance: tittèkèk a ta Dios, maski a:no i digat, awannataw pabayan.
unit.utterance_translation: You should pray to God. Whatever the difficulty may be, he will not neglect you.

unit.utterance: maski adin i e:nanmuy, amma munataw ta Dios, "Dios, to:panmutèn mangaytèn ta munati a lugar."
unit.utterance_translation: Wherever you are, if you do like that to God, as in "Lord, please be with me; I will go to such a place"
He will be with you.

unit.utterance: mangintate: ta agani:, maski awantaw ta kuwarto,
unit.utterance_translation: If (you) see non-Negrito people, even if you do not have money,
(if you) see a person, "Oh, come here."
"This is yours, your money."
That is what is seen
for God to (give) blessing.

unit.utterance: Tèn, awanku kabbat so:li a nidutul a meddèdès a uga:li
unit.utterance_translation: I do not want to be back to vicious habits before.
